alert.note: Alert for San Francisco (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued November 25 at 5:18PM PST until November 26 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO NOON PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, increased risk of sneaker waves. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...San Francisco County. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Sunday morning. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 AM to noon PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tidal levels are running about a third to a half foot above predictions. By high tide Sunday morning (peaking at around 10 AM PST), there will likely to be more minor coastal flooding.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
